review:
I wasn't much of a "lipstick all the time" person. Lipstick can be high-maintenance, plus I have pale lips and like it, especially for my everyday look- which I prefer to be more natural. However I adore the subtle shades this new lipstick line offers, and absolutely love how easy, no-maintenance it is. It stays on virtually forever and never(I mean NEVER) smears.
However, it is dry. Not when you first apply it but shortly afterward. And it's more of a matte than a glossy finish, which personally I don't mind at all. Besides, I've found that a thin layer of clear chapstick or gloss will combat the dryness issue and add some shine.
So bottom line- I'd recommend this to a friend, depending on what they're looking for. If you want a bold, moisturizing, glossy-finish lipstick then no, this isn't for you. But if you don't mind either the dry/matte aspect or adding some gloss over top, and you want a long-lasting, doesn't budge, "you mean I can wear lipstick without checking the mirror every 20 minutes to be sure it's still there and on the right part of my face" lipstick then yes, you'll want this.

Personally, it's made a "lipstick-everyday" girl out of me!

name: Garnet074
review:
I've been hunting for a lip product that actually stays put, more of a lip stain type look. With the market flooded by lipsticks, lip tints, tinted balms, lip gloss, etc., it's next to impossible to find something that truly stays when it says it's going to stay, so I've tried tons of products from tubes to tins to "chubby" pencils. This week I tried Revlon's Color Stay Ultimate Suede lipstick and I gotta say... it stays!

The color selection on the line seems to trend toward 3 tones: Pink, Red, Brown. I'm not overly blown away by the selection, but there is enough there that someone should be able to find something that works for them.

I applied it soon as I got out of the store. Goes on smooth, seemed surprisingly shiny, went on moist. After that I left it alone. No rubbing of my lips together, no blotting, nothing as I drove to my next location. I noticed a stickiness to my lips, but I didn't think it was that bad compared to some of the products I've tried. Some of those are like glue where you have to peel your lips apart. This is NOT one of those products and if you let it dry until that stickiness is all but gone, I think you get a much superior result than if you don't wait.

I forgot all about my lips through lunch. I ate, drank, talked, wiped my mouth with napkins, etc., with nary a notice of color transfer (YES!). When I got back into my car and glanced in the rear view mirror? The color was still there! Not "just kinda" still there "maybe I need to re-apply" but still there pow! noticeable color!

Gone was the shiny finish, moisture feel, and stickiness, and left behind was a matte color stain. Were my lips dry? Yes. Did they feel "dry" as in "ew my lips I dry I need a balm"? No. And that stain stayed and stayed and stayed until much later in the evening.

So I think the keys to successful application are to apply and leave it alone! Let it dry. Watch for that glossy sheen to fade off and the matte look to appear. This can take a little while. I'd also caution against applying a clear gloss or balm on top of the this product because I think that definitely shortens the staying power and "lifts" the color. I think these are tricks to help the staying power and I've pretty much learned you can't really have "shiny" or "wet" and stain. That's jmho.

I gave this the night test too. I applied it in the evening, slept all night in it (I know, I know, not something you're supposed to do but I was curious) and when I got up? Not a trace of color on the pillow case or my face but it was still on my lips.

I'm impressed with this product enough to be shopping for more colors on the best sale.
